00032 template<class POINTLIKE>   
00033 float calcAngle( const POINTLIKE& pl0,
00034                  const POINTLIKE& pl1,
00035                  const POINTLIKE& pl2 ) 
00036 {
00037    
00038    MC2Point p0 = getPoint( pl0 );
00039    MC2Point p1 = getPoint( pl1 );
00040    MC2Point p2 = getPoint( pl2 );
00041 
00042    int isLeft = InsideUtil::isLeft( p0, p1, p2 );
00043 
00044    // Make two vectors from the points.
00045    MC2Point v0 = p0 - p1;
00046    MC2Point v1 = p2 - p1;
00047 
00048    if ( isLeft == 0 ) {
00049       // Neither left or right, means 180 or 0 degrees.
00050       if ( v0.dot64( v1 ) < 0 ) {
00051          // Opposing vectors => negative dot product => 180 degrees.
00052          return 180.0;
00053       } else {
00054          return 0.0;
00055       }
00056    }
00057 
00058    // Get the cosangle from dot product formula.
00059    float cosangle = v0.dot64( v1 ) / 
00060       sqrt( double(v0.dot64( v0 ) ) * v1.dot64( v1 ) );
00061 
00062    // Calculate the abs value of the angle (can max be 180).
00063    float absangle = float( acos( cosangle ) / M_PI * 180 );
00064 
00065    // The resulting angle shall increase ccw.
00066    float angle = absangle;
00067    if ( isLeft > 0 ) {
00068       angle = 360 - angle;
00069    }
00070 
00071    return angle;
00072 }
00073    
00081 template<class ITERATOR>
00082 bool selfIntersecting( const ITERATOR& begin,
00083                        const ITERATOR& end )
00084 {
00085    // Only works for polygons known to be closed, i.e. not polylines or so.
00086    
00087    ITERATOR firstIt = begin;
00088    if ( firstIt == end ) {
00089       // There were too few
00090      return false;
00091    }
00092    ITERATOR middleIt = firstIt;
00093    ++middleIt;
00094    if ( middleIt == end ) {
00095       // There were too few
00096      return false;
00097    }
00098    ITERATOR nextIt = middleIt;
00099    ++nextIt;
00100    if ( nextIt == end ) {
00101       // There were too few
00102      return false;
00103    }
00104    float angleSum = 0;
00105    int nbrCorners = 0;
00106    int clockwiseRes = isClockWise( begin, end );
00107    if ( clockwiseRes < 0 ) {
00108       mc2dbg << "isClockWise failed" << endl;
00109    }
00110    bool wasClockwise = clockwiseRes;
00111    for ( ; middleIt != end; ++firstIt, ++middleIt, ++nextIt ) {
00112       if ( nextIt == end ) {
00113          if ( *middleIt != *begin ) {
00114             // Polygon not manually closed.
00115             return false;
00116          }
00117          nextIt = begin;
00118          ++nextIt;
00119       }
00120 
00121       // XXX: This hopefully works also when calcAngle returns 0?
00122       float angle = calcAngle( *firstIt, *middleIt, *nextIt );
00123 
00124       ++nbrCorners;
00125 
00126       if ( ! wasClockwise ) {
00127          // Exterior angle.
00128          mc2dbg8 << "Exterior angle." << endl;
00129          angle = (360 - angle );
00130       } else {
00131          // Interior angle.
00132          mc2dbg8 << "Interior angle." << endl;
00133       }
00134       
00135       angleSum += angle;
00136 
00137       mc2dbg8 << ", angle = " << angle << endl;
00138    }
00139    int expectedAngle = (nbrCorners - 2) * 180;
00140    mc2dbg8 << "checkSelfIntersect: corners = " << nbrCorners 
00141           << ", expectedAngle = " << expectedAngle
00142           << ", angleSum = " << angleSum 
00143           << ", wasClockwise = " << wasClockwise << endl;
00144 
00145    bool selfIntersect = ! (fabs(angleSum - expectedAngle) < 90);
00146    if ( selfIntersect ) {
00147       mc2dbg8 << "GfxUtil::selfIntersecting returns true. Corners = " << nbrCorners 
00148              << ", expectedAngle = " << expectedAngle
00149              << ", angleSum = " << angleSum 
00150              << ", wasClockwise = " << wasClockwise << endl;
00151 #if 0
00152       cout << "EOF" << endl;
00153       cout << "cat > before.gnu << EOF" << endl;
00154       cout << GnuPlotDump::gp_dump( begin, end ) << endl;
00155       cout << "EOF" << endl;
00156       cout << "gnuplot" << endl;
00157       cout << "plot \"before.gnu\" with linespoints";
00158       cout << endl << flush;
00159 #endif
00160    }
00161    return selfIntersect;
00162 
00163 }   
00167 bool getIntersection(int32 x1, int32 y1, int32 x2, int32 y2,
00168                      int32 v1, int32 w1, int32 v2, int32 w2,
00169                      int32& intersectX, int32& intersectY,
00170                      float64& percentFromx1y1,

00177 template<class ITERATOR>
00178 bool selfIntersectingSlowAndNotWorking( const ITERATOR& begin,
00179                                         const ITERATOR& end )
00180 {
00181    // The iterator copying can probably be reduced, but
00182    // since the complexity is N^2
00183    for ( ITERATOR it = begin; it != end; ++it ) {
00184       ITERATOR nextIt = it;
00185       ++nextIt;
00186       if ( nextIt == end ) {
00187          // Done
00188          break;
00189       }
00190       for ( ITERATOR jt = nextIt; jt != end; ++jt ) {
00191          if ( jt == nextIt ) {
00192             continue;
00193          }
00194          ITERATOR nextJt = jt;
00195          ++nextJt;
00196          if ( nextJt == end ) {
00197             break;
00198          }
00199          if ( it == begin ) {
00200             ITERATOR nextNextJt = nextJt;
00201             ++nextNextJt;
00202             if ( nextNextJt == end && (*nextJt) == (*begin) ) {
00203                // Last coord same as first and "it" is at start               
00204                break;
00205             }
00206          }
00207          int32 intersectX;
00208          int32 intersectY;
00209          float64 alpha1;
00210          float64 alpha2;
00211          //MC2_ASSERT( *it != *jt );
00212          //MC2_ASSERT( *nextIt != *nextJt );
00213          //MC2_ASSERT( *it != *nextJt );
00214          //MC2_ASSERT( *jt != *nextIt );
00215          if ( getIntersection( getCoordX(*it),
00216                                getCoordY(*it),
00217                                getCoordX(*nextIt),
00218                                getCoordY(*nextIt),
00219                                getCoordX(*jt),
00220                                getCoordY(*jt),
00221                                getCoordX(*nextJt),
00222                                getCoordY(*nextJt),
00223                                intersectX,
00224                                intersectY,
00225                                alpha1,
00226                                alpha2 ) ) {
00227             mc2dbg << "[Intersect]: intersection at ("
00228                    << intersectY << "," << intersectX << ")"
00229                    << " alpha1 = " << alpha1 
00230                    << " alpha2 = " << alpha2 
00231                    << endl;
00232             return true;
00233          }
00234       }
00235    }
00236    return false;
00237 }
